title: (x) Decemberists' Picaresque - Phidian {Mike F}
content:
I found one of the fonts sought for this image after the thread expired:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826140544im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/68616.jpg)   
   
Bus Mall was set in the old typeface Phidian, which appears like so in the Solotype Catalog:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826140544im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/68617.gif)   
   
The only digital version I'm aware of is by Dan Solo and, according to [Luc DeVroye](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826140544/http:/jeff.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/western.html) (see the   
Solotype entry), Phidian is included on the [24 Victorian Display Fonts CD-ROM](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826140544/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0486999564/qid=1112484352/sr=8-1/ref=sr_8_xs_ap_i1_xgl14/104-6249154-7928729?v=glance&s=books&n=507846).
author: Mike F

comments.content:
Way to stick with it Mike! That's the kind of dedication that makes this Board so special.   
   
Really, good job.
The only one left is that old style serif face with chunky serifs, innit?
